content.webTitle: Danny Murphy on brink of new one-year deal at Fulham

fields.headline: Danny Murphy on brink of new one-year deal at Fulham
fields.bodyText: Danny Murphy is to sign a new one-year deal at Fulham, with agreement close on the terms of the contract. The 33-year-old has excelled at Craven Cottage since his £2m move from Tottenham Hotspur in 2007 and has impressed the club's new management team this season. "We are still talking but we are very hopeful that a deal will be concluded very quickly," the Fulham manager, Mark Hughes, said. "There's a will to do it on both sides. Danny's a fit guy, leads his life well and there's no reason why he cannot play at the top level for a number of years." Shaun Wright-Phillips's proposed move from Manchester City to Fulham may depend on whether the midfielder is prepared to join the club on loan. Fulham favour a temporary deal whereas Wright-Phillips would prefer a permanent move.
